CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 9, 1958, pg. 2 reads: " At Bethany Church Meeting - Approximately 190 persons gathered in Bethany Baptist Church to pray, sing and hear the Bible read, and to vote on the issue of whether the Rev. Clarence E. McFadden should remain as pastor of the church. The meeting was held, with Atty. Oliver Johnson as court-appointed master and moderator, under regulation of the Common Pleas Court.  The group voted 108-78 to remove the pastor in a quiet, dignified, orderly fashion. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of men and women seated on wooden folding chairs in basement of Bethany Baptist Church for vote on Rev. Clarence E. McFadden's tenure
